attributes.comment:
As an international adoptive parent awaiting my referral for more than 14 months, I
must refile my USCIS fingerprints and visa paperwork this Fall. Adoption is a very
expensive task where even a simple increase can hurt a family's chances of
completing the process.

The proposed changes include:
1.) Biometrics (fingerprints) from $70 to $80 per person, and
2.) the I-600A from $545 to $670.

While this may not seem like much money to USCIS, when taken into account
with fee increases by local and state government offices, adoption agencies and
foreign governments, it all adds up! My husband and I are looking at another
$1000 in fees due this Fall simply because our paperwork is expiring and costs
are rising across the board. We can't control anything in this process from
infertility to other countries' policies on adopting to the cost of an adoption. We
can't even control whether a domestic birthmother selects us for a US adoption or
whether the foster care system will deem it TODAY that they call us back about
wanting to adopt. We are at the mercy of everyone else in our quest to become
parents.

It would be nice if one component of this process could side with the adoptive
parent.,..could think for just a moment what the impact would be on us! It would
be wonderful if that one agency was USCIS.

Send a message to the world that USCIS values adoption! That children deserve
homes and that Americans welcome these children. Help us start our family.
Don't create additional roadblocks to it. There are enough already.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Sheila Boyd
